Wow!! Barbara Harvey knocked it out of the park! Fantastic way to end the evening!
They gave me a Long list of cants... But I dreamed to dare.
After a car accident I had 3 surgeries and a six minute walking tolerance. I got down on my swollen knees and prayed.
My Counselors laughed when I said I wanted to go to college. I applied and got in... #deanslist #inyourface
RT @chipkimball: Barbara Harvey - a remarkable life - "dream to dare" @SAmericanSchool #sasedu #sasrocks https://t.co/avuHk2pRVZ
In order to move on to high school art you needed to be recommended. I wasn't. I went in and asked to join. They let me in and I stayed...
I'm a storyteller... It's what I do! They are woven into the things I teach my students.
Our final speaker tonight is Barbara Harvey and she is speaking about "Daring life's adversity"
Start exploring... Look beyond your fingertips!
Algorithms kill spontaneity....
You don't need an algorithm deciding how you should see the world.
Imagine a network with no filter. That's called real life.
Imagine your network without social media. Who is actually in your network?
Ideas are networks. When our newsfeed is filled with items determined an algorithm we are denied access to certain idea networks
The algorithm actually leads to you seeing less of the world, not more.
The Facebook algorithm influencing your newsfeed means that Facebook helps shape the way you see the world...
How could a simple equation define who I am? Ask Facebook.
Our next speaker Rhea Jain is speaking about social media stifling innovation
Allow yourself to be vulnerable. Share your failure stories. Try something you have no guarantee of success in.
Sharing failure stories helps bring individuals together...
My first drive was euphoric, till I smelt smoke. Then I popped the hood and saw the flames... #whatdidigetmyselfinto
Every time I got close something came up that pushed me back...
It was my time to take a risk... Sometimes you need to be naive to take the right risks.
This is the failure to success story about the first electric car in Singapore! https://t.co/aES5JHxDIy
Does listening to a billionaires failure story resonate with you?
It's become part of entrepreneurship to talk about failure. There are lots of failure stories out there. https://t.co/pOIdQDBHkn
RT @chipkimball: Nicole (gr 9) gave one of the most compelling talks I have ever heard. Grad student level. @SAmericanSchool #sasedu https:‚Ä¶

Next up is Jim Diebley and he is speaking about the 10
Year journey of the first electric car in Singapore!
@law_janet I completely agree! They are essential to helping each of us empathise with others. Great point!
Love the conversation and food in between sessions! #tedxyouthsas https://t.co/trPgavUqw3
If we erased our bad memories would that make our good memories simply mediocre? #thingstothinkabout
Could memory manipulation actually change who you are? Tampering with memories could potentially alter your identity...
Are bad memories needed to push society to progress?
Imagine turning back on the memories in someone suffering from Alzheimer's.
One of the toughest parts of drug rehab is trying to forget the pleasure derived from drug use. Removing the memories could be key to rehab
1 in 5 Americans who commit suicide are veterans that experience PTSD. Imagine if we could erase those traumatic memories.
By shining light on specific neurons, you can basically turn on and off memories.
Memory manipulation could be the future of how we see our past...
Do you think someone should be allowed to erase a memory of a tragic experience?
Imagine if you could erase memories of your failures or tragedies... Would you do it?
Our next speaker this evening is, Sunita Srivatsan and her talk is titled: Memory Manipulation!
The world debates definitions, but genocide is real. It is happening right now. #breakthesilence
Reconciliation is a nice word, but all it really does is sweep the truth under the rug. #justicemustprevail
Justice! Justice must come before reconciliation as a nation rebuilds after a genocide.
We need leaders in ideas, not just in politics.
Silence has become the coping mechanism for many survivors.
Which has priority at the end of a genocide- justice for the crimes, or national reconciliation?
Why is there such a hesitation to publicly call out these groups that are committing such terrible acts?
When evil doings fall like rain, nobody cries stop!
In the modern age we are not seeing fewer genocides. We are seeing more, but hearing less about them....
The most profound failure of humanity is mans ability to turn against itself...
Our next speaker is Nicole Weinrauch and her talk is titled "Breaking the silence on genocide" #tedxyouthsas
If you do not work on your dreams, who will?
Share your dreams- once you decide on a dream share it. When we share, we build momentum for our dreams. We succeed when we involve others!
To pursue our dreams we must be willing to leave our comfort zone. Take the first step...
What makes you happy? What did you enjoy doing in your youth? Revisit those interests and let them spark something in you now.
We have to decide which voice to follow. Follow the voice that motivates you to action!
You can still do more.... Sometimes we just need someone to spark the flame!
Don't wait 20 years to dream- you have the right to dream now! Find your passion, it will put you on the right path...
You have the right to dream, claim that right!
First up is Shuna Sun and her talk is titled: Claiming your right to dream! #tedxyouthsas

When PLCs become a part of our hiring, contracts, and evaluations, clarity is reinforced for all of us @sgjsparrow #ELC15bangkok #sasedu
Ask: is everything we do focused on student learning? @sgjsparrow #ELC15bangkok #sasedu
We must collectively take responsibility for the learning of ALL students. PLCs enable us to do that @sgjsparrow #ELC15bangkok #sasedu
Having the PLC structure has led to the innovation at #sasedu and the increase in student results @sgjsparrow #ELC15bangkok
Carving out time for PLCs at the expense of teaching time improves the quality of our teaching @sgjsparrow #ELC15bangkok #sasedu
As professionals, we need to base our direction on data using high standards of evidence @sgjsparrow #ELC15bangkok #sasedu
PLCs are the best, least expensive, most professionally rewarding way to improve schools @sgjsparrow #ELC15bangkok #sasedu
.@sgjsparrow kicking off a session about how #sasedu faculty have built high quality professional learning communities #ELC15bangkok

When teachers are involved in the change process, they believe in what the school is doing & will drive the change themselves #ELC15bangkok
To create a culture of innovation, we have to break the bureaucracy and look outward. @chipkimball #ELC15bangkok #sasedu
Schools should empower and create structures for leadership development for teachers @chipkimball #ELC15bangkok #sasedu
Know who you are as a school to attract teachers&administrators that will move you in the direction you want to go @drtstuart #ELC15bangkok
If you are going to change the paradigm, it requires a whole different set of teaching skills and leadership skills @drtstuart #ELC15bangkok
Challenging the status quo is difficult. We are re-envisioning ourselves in a system that has a new set of rules @chipkimball #ELC15bangkok
Teaching kids to think well will transcend any changes kids will face in the future. @chipkimball #ELC15bangkok #sasedu
The shift of ownership of learning is moving from teachers to students. @drtstuart #ELC15bangkok #sasedu
.@drtstuart The change process begins w a disruption. International schools are facing many disruptions. #ELC15bangkok #sasedu
